comment.text: Mediates cAMP-dependent signaling triggered by receptor binding to GPCRs. PKA activation regulates diverse cellular processes such as cell proliferation, the cell cycle, differentiation and regulation of microtubule dynamics, chromatin condensation and decondensation, nuclear envelope disassembly and reassembly, as well as regulation of intracellular transport mechanisms and ion flux. Regulates the abundance of compartmentalized pools of its regulatory subunits through phosphorylation of PJA2 which binds and ubiquitinates these subunits, leading to their subsequent proteolysis.
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.

A number of inactive tetrameric holoenzymes are produced by the combination of homo- or heterodimers of the different regulatory subunits associated with two catalytic subunits. cAMP causes the dissociation of the inactive holoenzyme into a dimer of regulatory subunits bound to four cAMP and two free monomeric catalytic subunits. The cAMP-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit binds PJA2 (By similarity).
Translocates into the nucleus (monomeric catalytic subunit). The inactive holoenzyme is found in the cytoplasm.

Isoform 1 is most abundant in the brain, with low level expression in kidney. Isoform 2 is predominantly expressed in thymus, spleen and kidney. Isoform 3 and isoform 4 are only expressed in the brain.
Asn-3 is partially deaminated to Asp giving rise to 2 major isoelectric variants, called CB and CA respectively.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. AGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family. cAMP subfamily.

property.value: PKA-mediated phosphorylation of key metabolic factors
Vasopressin regulates renal water homeostasis via Aquaporins
CREB phosphorylation through the activation of Adenylate Cyclase
Degradation of GLI1 by the proteasome
Degradation of GLI2 by the proteasome
GLI3 is processed to GLI3R by the proteasome
Factors involved in megakaryocyte development and platelet production
P:activation of protein kinase A activity
P:adenylate cyclase-modulating G-protein coupled receptor signaling pathway
P:negative regulation of meiotic cell cycle
P:negative regulation of smoothened signaling pathway involved in dorsal/ventral neural tube patterning
P:stimulatory C-type lectin receptor signaling pathway
